name: pi
desc: The ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter, a fundamental mathematical constant appearing in geometry, trigonometry, and many other fields.

name: tau
desc: Tau constant, equal to 2 times pi (2π), often used in circle-related calculations and considered by some to be more natural than pi.

name: e
desc: Euler's number, the base of the natural logarithm, crucial in exponential growth, differential equations, and complex analysis.

name: phi
desc: The golden ratio, a special number often found in art, architecture, and nature, associated with aesthetically pleasing proportions.

name: sqrt2
desc: Square root of 2, one of the first known irrational numbers, frequently appearing in the Pythagorean theorem.

name: sqrt3
desc: Square root of 3, commonly encountered in geometric calculations, such as the height of an equilateral triangle.

name: ln2
desc: Natural logarithm of 2, often used in exponential and logarithmic calculations.

name: ln10
desc: Natural logarithm of 10, connecting the base-10 logarithm to the natural logarithm.

name: gamma
desc: Euler–Mascheroni constant, significant in number theory and analysis, especially in problems related to prime number distribution.

name: c
desc: Speed of light in vacuum in meters per second, a fundamental physical constant central to relativity theory.

name: h
desc: Planck constant, foundational in quantum mechanics, relating energy and frequency.

name: ħ
desc: Reduced Planck constant (Dirac constant), equal to Planck constant divided by 2π, important in quantum mechanics formulas.

name: G
desc: Gravitational constant, determining the strength of gravitational force between masses in Newton's law of universal gravitation.

name: k
desc: Boltzmann constant, linking temperature and energy in statistical physics.

name: Na
desc: Avogadro's number, the number of constituent particles (usually atoms or molecules) in one mole of substance.

name: qe
desc: Elementary charge, the magnitude of electric charge carried by a proton or electron, fundamental to electromagnetism.

name: me
desc: Electron mass in kilograms, fundamental particle mass.

name: mp
desc: Proton mass in kilograms, constituent of atomic nuclei.

name: μ0
desc: Vacuum permeability (magnetic constant), defines the magnetic properties of vacuum.

name: ε0
desc: Vacuum permittivity (electric constant), characterizes the electric properties of vacuum.

name: σ
desc: Stefan–Boltzmann constant, relates the total energy radiated per unit surface area of a black body to the fourth power of its temperature.

name: R
desc: Ideal gas constant, relates pressure, volume, and temperature of an ideal gas.

name: g
desc: Standard acceleration due to gravity on Earth's surface in meters per second squared.

name: alpha
desc: Fine-structure constant, a dimensionless constant characterizing the strength of electromagnetic interaction.
